metadata.description: Advanced verbs - specialized actions and complex constructions

present.spanish: Me preocupo mucho por mi familia.
present.english: I worry a lot about my family.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te preocupas demasiado por el trabajo.
present.english: You (informal) worry too much about work.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Me preocupo cuando no me contestas el mensaje.
present.english: I worry when you don't answer my message.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: No te preocupes; todo va a salir bien.
present.english: Don't worry; everything is going to be fine.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Mi mamá se preocupa mucho por mí.
present.english: My mom worries about me a lot.
present.subject: ella

present.english: I worry about you.
present.subject: yo

present.english: You (informal) worry too much.
present.subject: tú

present.english: He worries about the future.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Me preocupé mucho cuando no llegaste a casa.
preterite.english: I worried a lot when you didn't come home.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Ustedes se preocuparon por los resultados del trabajo.
preterite.english: You all (vosotros) worried about the work results.
preterite.subject: vosotros

future.spanish: Me preocuparé menos cuando tengas trabajo estable.
future.english: I will worry less when you have stable work.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te preocuparás por tus hijos cuando sean adolescentes.
future.english: You (informal) will worry about your children when they're teenagers.
future.subject: tú

going-to.english: I am going to worry.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.spanish: Te vas a preocupar por nada.
going-to.english: You (informal) are going to worry about nothing.
going-to.subject: tú

present-perfect.spanish: Me he preocupado toda la noche.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te diviertes jugando videojuegos con amigos.
present.english: You (informal) have fun playing video games with friends.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te diviertes bailando tango en la milonga.
present.english: You (vos) have fun dancing tango at the milonga.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Siempre me divierto cuando salgo con mis amigos.
present.english: I always have fun when I go out with my friends.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: ¿Te diviertes en tus clases de español?
present.english: Are you (informal) having fun in your Spanish classes?
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Los niños se divierten en el parque todas las tardes.
present.english: The kids have fun at the park every afternoon.
present.subject: ellas

present.english: I have fun at parties.
present.subject: yo

present.english: You (informal) have fun with your friends.
present.subject: tú

present.english: He has fun playing.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Me divertí muchísimo en la fiesta de cumpleaños.
preterite.english: I had a great time at the birthday party.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se divirtió jugando con sus nietos en el jardín.
preterite.english: He had fun playing with his grandchildren in the garden.
preterite.subject: él

future.spanish: Me divertiré mucho en las vacaciones de verano.
future.english: I will have a lot of fun on summer vacation.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te divertirás aprendiendo a tocar la guitarra.
future.english: You (informal) will have fun learning to play guitar.
future.subject: tú

present-progressive.english: I am having a lot of fun.
present-progressive.subject: yo

present-progressive.spanish: Se está divirtiendo en el parque.
present-progressive.english: He is having fun in the park.

going-to.spanish: Te vas a divertir en la playa.

present-perfect.english: I have had a lot of fun today.
present-perfect.subject: yo

present-perfect.spanish: Se ha divertido en el viaje.
present-perfect.english: He has had fun on the trip.
present-perfect.subject: él

present.spanish: Te encuentras con tus amigos cada sábado.
present.english: You (informal) meet with your friends every Saturday.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Está trabajando en un proyecto importante.
present.english: He is working on an important project.

quality.fix_issue: Spanish wording awkward + English translation unnatural

present.english: You (informal) feel tired.
